Bash(git commit -m "Fix Prisma client import in services

Fixed critical bug where Prisma client was undefined at runtime.

Issue: Services were using named import { prisma } but prisma.ts
exports default prisma, causing ''Cannot read properties of undefined''
errors.

Fixed imports in:
- items.service.ts
- wishes.service.ts
- friends.service.ts

Changed from:
  import { prisma } from ''../utils/prisma''
To:
  import prisma from ''../utils/prisma''

This fixes the backend crash when trying to fetch items/wishes feeds.

Bash(git commit -m "Fix JWT payload property access in controllers

Fixed critical bug where controllers were accessing req.user!.id
instead of req.user!.userId, causing undefined userId errors.

Issue: JWT payload contains ''userId'' field, but all controllers
were trying to access ''id'', resulting in undefined values being
passed to services and Prisma errors.

Fixed in:
- items.controller.ts (all 7 methods)
- wishes.controller.ts (all 7 methods)
- friends.controller.ts (all 8 methods)

Changed from:
  const userId = req.user!.id
To:
  const userId = req.user!.userId

This fixes create/update/delete operations for items, wishes,
and all friends operations.

Bash(git commit -m "Add missing BadRequestError class to errors utility

Fixed critical bug where services were trying to use BadRequestError
but it wasn''t exported from the errors module.

Issue: friends.service.ts and items.service.ts were importing and
using BadRequestError, but it didn''t exist in utils/errors.ts,
causing ''BadRequestError is not a constructor'' errors.

Added BadRequestError class:
- Extends AppError
- Uses 400 status code
- Uses VALIDATION_ERROR error code
- Same as ValidationError but with different name for clarity

This fixes the ''You are already friends'' error handling in
friends.service.ts.

Bash(git commit -m "Improve user search to exclude existing friends and pending requests

Enhanced the searchUsers function to filter out users who already
have a relationship with the current user.

Changes:
- Search now excludes users who are already friends (ACCEPTED)
- Search now excludes users with pending friend requests (PENDING)
- Prevents confusing UX where ''Add Friend'' button appears for
  existing friends
- Backend now correctly prevents duplicate friend request errors

This improves the user experience by only showing users who can
actually receive new friend requests.

Note: Since seed data has Emma, Marcus, and Aisha all as friends,
searching for any of them will return no results when logged in as
any of them. To test friend requests, either:
1. Register a new user
2. Remove a friendship from the database
3. Add more test users to seed data
